item.title: Value at Risk: ¿What is VaR? (Ep. 1)
item.description: Value-at-Risk (VaR) como medida de riesgo \[ Pr(Loss > VaR) = p \] \[ \begin{aligned} Pr( -R_{PF} > VaR) &= p \quad \Leftrightarrow \\ Pr( -R_{PF} > VaR) &= p \end{aligned} \] \[ \begin{aligned} Pr(R_{PF,t+1} < -VaR^{p}_{t+1}) &= p \quad \Leftrightarrow \\ Pr(R_{PF,t+1}/\sigma_{PF,t+1} < -VaR^{p}_{t+1}/\sigma_{PF,t+1}) &= p \quad \Leftrightarrow \\ Pr(z_{t+1} < VaR^{p}_{t+1}/\sigma_{PF,t+1}) &= p \quad \Leftrightarrow \\ Pr(R_{PF,t+1} < -VaR^{p}_{t+1}) &= p \quad \Leftrightarrow \\ \Phi(-VaR^{p}_{t+1}/\sigma_{PF,t+1}) &= p \end{aligned} \]

item.title: Replicate research studies for knowledge development
item.description: Forecasting stock returns Forecasting stock returns (Rapach and Zhou, 2013) Download data.xlsx Monthly U.S. equity premium out-of-sample forecasting results based on individual economic variables with unrestricted and Predictive regression forecasts with Campbell and Thompson (2008). item.title: Economic data in motion
item.description: if(!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman") ## Loading required package: pacman p_load("tidyverse", "tidyquant", "gganimate", "bbplot") tickers <- c("LRHUTTTTFRM156S", "LRHUTTTTDEM156S", "LRHUTTTTUSM156S", "LRHUTTTTJPM156S") countries_name <- c("France", "Germany", "United States", "Japan") unemployment_lst <- list() for(i in seq_along(tickers)){ unemployment_lst[[i]] <- tq_get(tickers[i], get = "economic.data", from = "2000-01-01", to = "2018-11-01") %>% mutate(symbol = countries_name[i]) } unemployment_tbl <- do.
